00037 #ifndef __RS232_H__
00038 #define __RS232_H__
00039 
00040 #include <avr/pgmspace.h>
00041 #include "contiki-conf.h"
00042 
00043 #if defined (__AVR_ATmega128__)
00044 #include "dev/rs232_atmega128.h"
00045 #elif defined (__AVR_ATmega1281__)
00046 #include "dev/rs232_atmega1281.h"
00047 #elif defined (__AVR_ATmega1284P__)
00048 #include "dev/rs232_atmega1284.h"
00049 #elif defined (__AVR_AT90USB1287__)
00050 #include "dev/rs232_at90usb1287.h"
00051 #elif defined (__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00052 #include "dev/rs232_atmega128rfa1.h"
00053 #elif defined (__AVR_ATmega644__) || defined (__AVR_ATmega328P__)
00054 #include "dev/rs232_atmega644.h"
00055 #elif defined (__AVR_ATmega8__) || defined (__AVR_ATmega8515__) \
00056    || defined (__AVR_ATmega16__) || defined (__AVR_ATmega32__)
00057 #include "dev/rs232_atmega32.h"
00058 #else
00059 #error "Please implement a rs232 header for your MCU (or set the MCU type \
00060 in contiki-conf.h)."
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 /******************************************************************************/
00064 /***   Baud rates                                                             */
00065 /******************************************************************************/
00066 #define BAUD_RATE(x) (F_CPU/16/x-1)
00067 
00068 /**
00069  * \brief      Initialize the RS232 module
00070  *
00071  *             This function is called from the boot up code to
00072  *             initalize the RS232 module.
00073  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00074  * \param bd   The baud rate of the connection.
00075  * \param ffmt The frame format of the connection, i.e. parity mode,
00076  *             number of stop and data bits, ...
00077  */
00078 void
00079 rs232_init (uint8_t port, uint8_t bd, uint8_t ffmt);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * \brief      Set an input handler for incoming RS232 data
00083  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00084  * \param f    A pointer to a byte input handler
00085  *
00086  *             This function sets the input handler for incoming RS232
00087  *             data. The input handler function is called for every
00088  *             incoming data byte. The function is called from the
00089  *             RS232 interrupt handler, so care must be taken when
00090  *             implementing the input handler to avoid race
00091  *             conditions.
00092  *
00093  *             The return value of the input handler affects the sleep
00094  *             mode of the CPU: if the input handler returns non-zero
00095  *             (true), the CPU is awakened to let other processing
00096  *             take place. If the input handler returns zero, the CPU
00097  *             is kept sleeping.
00098  */
00099 void
00100 rs232_set_input(uint8_t port, int (* f)(unsigned char));
00101 
00102 
00103 /**
00104  * \brief      Print a text string from program memory on RS232
00105  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00106  * \param buf  A pointer to the string that is to be printed
00107  *
00108  *             This function prints a string from program memory to
00109  *             RS232. The string must be terminated by a null
00110  *             byte. The RS232 module must be correctly initalized and
00111  *             configured for this function to work.
00112  */
00113 void
00114 rs232_print_p(uint8_t port, prog_char *buf);
00115 
00116 /**
00117  * \brief      Print a text string on RS232
00118  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00119  * \param str  A pointer to the string that is to be printed
00120  *
00121  *             This function prints a string to RS232. The string must
00122  *             be terminated by a null byte. The RS232 module must be
00123  *             correctly initalized and configured for this function
00124  *             to work.
00125  */
00126 void
00127 rs232_print(uint8_t port, char *buf);
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * \brief      Print a formated string on RS232
00131  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00132  * \param fmt  The format string that is used to construct the string
00133  *             from a variable number of arguments.
00134  *
00135  *             This function prints a formated string to RS232. Note
00136  *             that this function used snprintf internally and thus cuts
00137  *             the resulting string after RS232_PRINTF_BUFFER_LENGTH - 1
00138  *             bytes. You can override this buffer lenght with the
00139  *             RS232_CONF_PRINTF_BUFFER_LENGTH define. The RS232 module
00140  *             must becorrectly initalized and configured for this
00141  *             function to work.
00142  */
00143 void
00144 rs232_printf(uint8_t port, const char *fmt, ...);
00145 
00146 /**
00147  * \brief      Print a character on RS232
00148  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00149  * \param c    The character to be printed
00150  *
00151  *             This function prints a character to RS232. The RS232
00152  *             module must be correctly initalized and configured for
00153  *             this function to work.
00154  */
00155 void
00156 rs232_send(uint8_t port, unsigned char c);
00157 
00158 /**
00159  * \brief      Redirects stdout to a given RS232 port
00160  * \param port The RS232 port to be used.
00161  *
00162  *             This function redirects the stdout channel to a given
00163  *             RS232 port. Note that this modfies the global variable
00164  *             stdout. If you want to restore the previous behaviour, it
00165  *             is your responsibility to backup to old value. The RS232
00166  *             module must be correctly initalized and configured for
00167  *             the redirection to work.
00168  */
00169 void
00170 rs232_redirect_stdout (uint8_t port);
00171 
00172 #endif /* __RS232_H__ */
Generated on Tue May 8 2012 20:13:04 for Contiki 2.5 by  1.7.4
